declarations.comments: Monad responsible for application related operations (initial setup mostly).
declarations.title: AppM

declarations.comments:
Run application on specified port and execute callback after launch.
HTTP version
declarations.title: listenHttp

declarations.comments:
Run application on specified port and execute callback after launch.
HTTPS version
declarations.title: listenHttps

declarations.comments:
Run application on specified port & host and execute callback after launch.
HTTP version
declarations.title: listenHostHttp

declarations.comments:
Run application on specified port & host and execute callback after launch.
HTTPS version
declarations.title: listenHostHttps

declarations.comments:
Run application on specified named pipe and execute callback after launch.
HTTP version
declarations.title: listenPipe

declarations.comments:
Create a Node.HTTP server from the Express application.
HTTP version
declarations.title: makeHttpServer

declarations.comments:
Create a Node.HTTP server from the Express application.
HTTPS version
declarations.title: makeHttpsServer

declarations.comments: Apply App actions to existent Express.js application
declarations.title: apply

declarations.comments: Use specified middleware handler.
declarations.title: use

declarations.comments:
Use any function as middleware.
Introduced to ease usage of a bunch of external
middleware written for express.js.
See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#middleware
declarations.title: useExternal

declarations.comments: Use specified middleware only on requests matching path.
declarations.title: useAt

declarations.comments:
Use any function as middleware only on requests matching path.
Introduced to ease usage of a bunch of external
middleware written for express.js.
See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#middleware
declarations.title: useAtExternal

declarations.comments: Process route param with specified handler.
declarations.title: useOnParam

declarations.comments: Use error handler. Probably this should be the last middleware to attach.
declarations.title: useOnError

declarations.comments:
Get application property.
See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#app-settings
declarations.title: getProp

declarations.comments:
Set application property.
See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#app-settings
declarations.title: setProp

declarations.comments: Bind specified handler to handle request matching route and method.
declarations.title: http

declarations.comments: Shortcut for `http GET`.
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments: Shortcut for `http POST`.
declarations.title: post

declarations.comments: Shortcut for `http PUT`.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments: Shortcut for `http DELETE`.
declarations.title: delete

declarations.comments: Shortcut for `http ALL` (match on any http method).
declarations.title: all

declarations.comments: Monad responsible for handling single request.
declarations.title: HandlerM

declarations.comments: Call next handler/middleware in a chain.
declarations.title: next

declarations.comments: Call next handler/middleware and pass error to it.
declarations.title: nextThrow

declarations.comments: Handler that parses cookies using 'cookie-parser' middleware.
declarations.title: cookieParser

declarations.comments: Handler that uses builtin 'static' middleware to serve files from specified location
declarations.title: static

declarations.comments:
Get route param value. If it is named route, e.g `/user/:id` then
`getRouteParam "id"` return matched part of route. If it is
regex route, e.g. `/user/(\d+)` then `getRouteParam 1` return
part that matched `(\d+)` and `getRouteParam 0` return whole
route.
declarations.title: getRouteParam

declarations.comments:
Get param from query string (part of URL behind '?').
It could be any JS object, e.g. an array in case multiple repeating query
parameters, or an object in case of nested query parameters (this
particular behavior depends on the type of query parser - 'simple' won't
parse complex objects, see
https://github.com/expressjs/express/blob/master/test/req.query.js)
declarations.title: getQueryParam

declarations.comments: Shortcut for `getQueryParam paramName :: HandlerM (Maybe (Array a))`
declarations.title: getQueryParams

declarations.comments:
Get the request's body.
NOTE: Not parsed by default, you must attach proper middleware
      See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#req.body
declarations.title: getBody

declarations.comments:
Get the request's body without a `Decode` parsing.
NOTE: Not parsed by default, you must attach proper middleware
      See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#req.body
declarations.title: getBody'

declarations.comments:
Get param from request's body.
NOTE: Not parsed by default, you must attach proper middleware
      See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#req.body
declarations.title: getBodyParam

declarations.comments: Return route that matched this request.
declarations.title: getRoute

declarations.comments: Get cookie param by its key.
declarations.title: getCookie

declarations.comments: Get signed cookie param by its key.
declarations.title: getSignedCookie

declarations.comments: Get request header param.
declarations.title: getRequestHeader

declarations.comments: Check if specified response type will be accepted by a client.
declarations.title: accepts

declarations.comments: Execute specified handler if client accepts specified response type.
declarations.title: ifAccepts

declarations.comments: Check if specified charset is accepted.
declarations.title: acceptsCharset

declarations.comments: Check if specified language is accepted.
declarations.title: acceptsLanguage

declarations.comments:
Check if request's Content-Type field matches type.
See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#req.is
declarations.title: hasType

declarations.comments: Return remote or upstream address.
declarations.title: getRemoteIp

declarations.comments: Return list of X-Forwarded-For proxies if any.
declarations.title: getRemoteIps

declarations.comments: Return request URL pathname.
declarations.title: getPath

declarations.comments: Return Host header field.
declarations.title: getHostname

declarations.comments: Return array of subdomains.
declarations.title: getSubdomains

declarations.comments: Check that Last-Modified and/or ETag still matches.
declarations.title: isFresh

declarations.comments: Check that Last-Modified and/or ETag do not match.
declarations.title: isStale

declarations.comments: Check if request was issued by XMLHttpRequest.
declarations.title: isXhr

declarations.comments: Return request protocol.
declarations.title: getProtocol

declarations.comments: Return request HTTP method
declarations.title: getMethod

declarations.comments: Return request URL (may be modified by other handlers/middleware).
declarations.title: getUrl

declarations.comments: Return request original URL.
declarations.title: getOriginalUrl

declarations.comments: Retrieves the data from the request set with previous call to `setUserData`
declarations.title: getUserData

declarations.comments:
Sets the specified field of the userData object attached to the Request
object to specified data
declarations.title: setUserData

declarations.comments: Set status code.
declarations.title: setStatus

declarations.comments: Return response header value.
declarations.title: getResponseHeader

declarations.comments: Set response header value.
declarations.title: setResponseHeader

declarations.comments: Check if headers have been sent already
declarations.title: headersSent

declarations.comments: Set Content-Type header.
declarations.title: setContentType

declarations.comments: Set cookie by its name using specified options (maxAge, path, etc).
declarations.title: setCookie

declarations.comments: Clear cookie.
declarations.title: clearCookie

declarations.comments: Send a response. Could be object, string, buffer, etc.
declarations.title: send

declarations.comments: Send a JSON response. Necessary headers are set automatically.
declarations.title: sendJson

declarations.comments: Send a JSON response with JSONP support.
declarations.title: sendJsonp

declarations.comments: Redirect to the given URL setting status to 302.
declarations.title: redirect

declarations.comments: Redirect to the given URL using custom status.
declarations.title: redirectWithStatus

declarations.comments: Set Location header.
declarations.title: setLocation

declarations.comments: Send file by its path.
declarations.title: sendFile

declarations.comments:
Send file by its path using specified options and error handler.
See http://expressjs.com/4x/api.html#res.sendfile
declarations.title: sendFileExt

declarations.comments: Transfer file as an attachment (will prompt user to download).
declarations.title: download

declarations.comments: Transfer file as an attachment using specified filename and error handler.
declarations.title: downloadExt

declarations.comments: Render a view with a view model object. Could be object, string, buffer, etc.
declarations.title: render

declarations.comments: Ends the response process.
declarations.title: end

declarations.comments:
Cookie options
- maxAge -- time in msecs
- signed -- use secret to sign if true
- path   -- cookie path
declarations.title: CookieOptions
